CDM.BiologicallyDerivedProduct.description: A living organism, or a metabolocally active biological system such as a cell culture, tissue culture, or organoid that is maintained or propagated in vitro.

description.description: A free text field to capture additional info/explanation about the model system

growth_rate.description: When the specimen an actively growing model system, such as a cell or tissue culture, this property captures its rate of growth.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

passage_number.description: When the specimen an actively growing model system, such as a cell or tissue culture, this property captures its passage number.

product_type.description: The high level type of model system (e.g. cell line, cell culture, tissue culture, organoid)

CDM.BiologicallyDerivedProduct.title: CDM.BiologicallyDerivedProduct

CDM.Exposure.description: Contact between an agent and a target. A state of contact or close proximity to a medicinal product, chemical, pathogen, radioisotope or other substance.

alcohol_use.description: A container holding a set of observations about an individual's exposure to alcohol.

environmental.description: Observations about an individual's exposure to environmental substances that may impact clinical outcomes.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

identifier.description: A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems.

related_patient.description: A reference to the Patient that is the subject of this Exposure

tobacco_use.description: A container holding a set of observations about an individual's exposure to tobacco.

CDM.Exposure.title: CDM.Exposure

CDM.Organization.description: A grouping of people or organizations with a common purpose such as a data coordinating center, an university, or an institute within a university

alias.description: A secondary name for the organization such as a short name or abbreviation (e.g. 'NCI')

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

identifier.description: A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems.

name.description: The full legal name by which the organization is known (e.g. 'National Cancer Institute')

organization_type.description: The type of the organization (e.g. 'Cancer Genome Characterization Center')

CDM.Organization.title: CDM.Organization

CDM.Patient.description: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

adverse_events.description: A reference to the AdverseEvent(s) experienced by this Patient

given_name.description: The given name for the patient, likely only applicable in non-human use cases given HIPAA restrictions on sharing of PII

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

identifier.description: A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems.

taxon.description: The taxonomic group (e.g. species) of the patient.

CDM.Patient.title: CDM.Patient

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

CDM.ResearchProject.description:
A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge. 
This includes studies of safety, efficacy, comparative effectiveness and other information about medications, devices, therapies and other interventional 
and investigative techniques. A ResearchProject involves the gathering of information about human or animal subjects.

date_ended.description: The date when the research project ended.

date_iacuc_approval.description: The date that the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) approved an animal study protocol. This date cannot be released to funding agencies until congruency between the animal use in the funding proposal and the IACUC approved protocol has been verified.

date_started.description: The date when the research project began.

description.description: An unabridged description of a research program, project, or study.

description_shortened.description: An abbreviated description of a research program, project, or study.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

identifier.description: A 'business' identifier  or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems.

name.description: An unabridged name of a research program, project, or study.

name_shortened.description: An abbreviated name of a research program, project, or study.

part_of.description: A reference to a parent ResearchProject (e.g. a link to the overarching CPTAC ResearchProject from a substudy of CPTAC)

primary_anatomic_site.description: The text term used to describe the general location of the malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

research_project_type.description: The 'type' of ResearchProject represented (e.g. a broad-based Program like 'CPTAC' or a more focused Project like 'CPTAC PDAC Discovery Study')

sponsor.description: An entity that is responsible for the initiation, management, and/or financing of a research project.

url.description: A URL address for a resource that provides information about a research program, project, or study.

CDM.ResearchProject.title: CDM.ResearchProject

CDM.ResearchSubject.description:
A research subject is the entity of interest in a research study, typically a human being or an animal, but can also be a device, group of humans or animals, 
or a tissue sample. Human research subjects are usually not traceable to a particular person to protect the subject’s privacy.

associated_patient.description: A reference to the Patient that is this ResearchSubject

associated_project.description: A reference to the Project(s) in which this ResearchSubject participates

description.description: A free text field to capture additional info/explanation about the research subject.

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

identifier.description: A 'business' identifier for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that persists across implementing systems.

index_timepoint.description: The text term used to describe the reference or anchor date used for date obfuscation, where a single date is obscured by creating one or more date ranges in relation to this date.

member_of_cohort.description: A reference to the Cohort(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member

member_of_study.description: A reference to the Study(s) of which this ResearchSubject is a member

originating_site.description: A clinical site that collects and provides patient samples and clinical metadata for research use.

primary_disease_site.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

primary_disease_type.description: The text term used to describe the type of malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

processed_at.description: The site at which a biospecimen entity was processed.

qualification_status_flag.description: Specifies if the ResearchSubject is qualified or disqualified for any reason. Usually the data related to such ResearchSubjects may be not used in the data analysis

reference_status_flag.description: A biospecimen entity which is used as a reference sample for determining relative protein abundances in labeling experiments.

study_progress.description: A data container holding information about the various states through which a ResearchSubject may pass during the course of their participation in a ResearchStudy

CDM.ResearchSubject.title: CDM.ResearchSubject

CDM.Specimen.description: Any material taken as a sample from a biological entity (living or dead), or from a physical object or the environment. Specimens are usually collected as an example of their kind, often for use in some investigation.

analyte_type.description: For speciemens of type 'analyte' (or an 'aliquot' derived from an analyte), this is the category of chemcial the analyte of interest represents (e.g. DNA, RNA)

associated_project.description: The Project associated with the specimen.

cellular_composition_measure.description: An observation that quantifies the relative or absolute composition of a specimen at cellular level, - i.e. how many cells in the specimen are of a given type, or exhibit a particular cellular phenotype. This information is typically determined through microscopic analysis of a slide.

cellular_composition_type.description: A term describing the type of material comprising a specimen at a celluar level.

condition_status_at_collection.description: The status of a patient's condition at the time the speimen was collected (e.g. if it was primary, recurrent, metastatic, etc).

contained_in.description: A physical container in which a specimen is held or attached -  as storage for future use,  a substrate for growth (e.g. a cell culture dish), or a vessel to enable analysis (e.g. a microscope slide or 96-well plate)

creation_activity.description: An activity or procedure through which a specimen was created, through removing material from an biological subject, or deriving material from an existing specimen.

derived_product.description: A 'living' biologically active product (e.g. a cell culture, tissue culture, or organoid) that was generated from the specimen

description.description: A free text field to capture additional information or explanation about the specimen.

dimensional_measure.description: An observation about the dimensions of an object, including lengths, areas, and volumes.

general_tissue_morphology.description: A term describing at a high-level the kind of tissue collected in a specimen, with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue (e.g. is it normal, abnormal, tumor, tumor-adjacent).

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

identifier.description: A 'business' identifier  or accession number for the entity, typically as provided by an external system or authority, that us globally unique and persists across implementing systems.

parent_specimen.description: An existing specimen from which the specimen of interest was directly derived (i.e its immediate parent specimen).

processing_activity.description: An activity that modifies the physical structure, composition, or state of a specimen.

provided_by.description: The organization/center that provided the specimen.

quality_measure.description: An observation about  specimen characteristics indicative of its quality or suitability for use.

quantity_measure.description: An observation related to the current quantity of a specimen or analyte it contains - e.g. its weight, volume, or concentration.

related_diagnosis.description: A patient diagnosis that was informed by a pathological assessment of the specimen

related_document?_related_report?.description: A reference to an external document that is about or related to the specimen (e.g. a publication related to the study it is a part of, pathology report containing additional details about it, protocol describing how it was collected, or a catalog entry describing  related research resource)

related_specimen.description: Another specimen to which this one is related in some way (excluding parent-child / derivation relationships, which are captured using the dedicated the source_specimen field)

section_location.description: The location in a parent specimen from which a section/portion was excised (e.g. top, middle, bottom)

source_material_type.description: The general kind of material from which the specimen was derived, based on the physical nature of the source material.

source_model_system.description: A Biologically Derived Material / model system (e.g. a cell line, tissue culture, organoid) from which a specimen was directly or indirectly derived.

source_patient.description: A Patient from which the specimen was directly or indirectly derived.

specific_tissue_morphology.description: A term describing the specific pathology exhibited by the tissue in a specimen.

specimen_type.description: The high-level type of the specimen, based on its derivation provenance (i.e. how far removed it is from the original sample extracted from a source).

storage_activity.description: An activity that results in the storage or maintenance of a specimen in a particular location, container, or state.

tissue_composition_measure.description: An observation about the absolute area or relative proportion of a specific type of tissue in a specimen or other biological material

transport_activity.description: An activity through which the specimen is transported between locations.

CDM.Specimen.title: CDM.Specimen

additive.description: A material substance added to the container.

charge_type.description: A descripton of the type of charge on a slide on which a specimen is mounted

container_number.description: Informal number/identifier by which the container is referenced (e.g. a slide number, or a well number in a plate)

container_type.description: The kind of container associated with the specimen.

parent_container.description: A larger container of which this container is a part (e.g. a single well in a 96-well plate)

CDM.SpecimenCreationActivity.description: The process of creating a specimen through observing and/or removing material from an biological source or natural setting (e.g. from a person, animal, cell line, or environmental material), or through derivation from an existing specimen (e.g. through portioning or aliquoting). This activity represents the entire process up to the point where the specimen is physically modified, stored, or transported.

activity_type.description: The high-level type of creation activity

collected_during_visit.description: A specific visit during which the specimen was collected.

collection_site.description: A data container holding information about the anatomic source of a specimen, including its location in the body, and the approach route used to access it.

date_ended.description: The date when the activity ended (in this case, a specimen creation event).

date_started.description: The date when the activity began (in this case, a specimen creation event).

execution_condition.description: Information describing the specified or observed conditions under which activity was executed

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

input_specimen.description: One or more existing specimens input into the specimen creation activity, from which a new specimen is derived (e.g. through portioning, aliquoting, sectioning, etc)

method_type.description: A specific type of method followed in performing the creation activity.

performed_by.description: The organization or group that performed the activity.

quantity_collected.description: The quantity of material in the specimen as originally collected from its original source material (prior to downstream portioning or processing)

relative_order.description: A numeric value that represents the sequential order of this collection process relative to that of collection processes producing specimens from the same source material or parent specimen.

relative_timing.description: The timing of the activity relative to some other activity or timepoint.

CDM.SpecimenCreationActivity.title: CDM.SpecimenCreationActivity

duration.description: The length of time over which the activity was performed.

performed_by.description: The organization or group that performed the activity.

CDM.SpecimenStorageActivity.description: A vessel in which a specimen is held or attached - to store or as a substrate for growth (e.g. a cell culture dish) or analysis (e.g. a microscope slide or 96-well plate)

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

CDM.SpecimenStorageActivity.title: CDM.SpecimenStorageActivity

CDM.SpecimenTransportActivity.description: An activity through which a specimen is transported between locations.

date_ended.description: The date when the activity ended (in this case, a transport event).

date_started.description: The date when the activity began (in this case, a transport event).

execution_conditions.description: An environmental condition under which the activity is executed (in this case, a transport activity).

id.description: The 'logical' identifier of the entity in the system of record.  This 'id' is guaranteed to be unique only within a given system, but not globally. The identified entity may have a different 'id' in a different system, and have many external business 'identifiers' associated with it.

transport_destination.description: An organization (facility, site, lab, etc) to which the specimen is delivered as a result of the activity.

CDM.SpecimenTransportActivity.title: CDM.SpecimenTransportActivity
